title: Firefox only opens a blank white screen
content:
For the last few days Firefox has been having loading problems. Most of the time (95%) Firefox only opens a white screen. I do not get the Pocket Home Page, if I type a URL in it simply tries to load it but nothing ever loads. If I try to type in "about:profiles" nothing happens. Occasionally a link will load. Although then if I try navigating else where it doesn't load. Firefox is up to date, that was the first thing I checked. I refreshed Firefox yesterday and that seemed to work, although today it was back to not loading. I uninstalled and reinstalled today. I tried refreshing after installing, setting up a new profile and nothing works. I can navigate the web on Chrome and get e-mail through Outlook just fine. I've scanned my computer with Webroot and found nothing. I can not get anything to load from navigating with navigation bar. I tried typing in "about:support" and it didn't load. I can go to the Help menu and select "more troubleshooting options" and then The Troubleshooting info loads.

Can anybody help me figure this mystery out?

title: Firefox Install Corrupted
content:
I began having problems with initial web page loading a couple of weeks ago. I would refresh the pages, they would load properly & I could browse without a problem. About 4 or 5 days ago, web pages stopped loading altogether, nor could i navigate to another page from my initial pages. When I launched Firefox, 5 home page tabs would load (my usual #) but they were either blank or the url was displayed with an error message. I did not record the message, but instead tried to refresh my browser. Once I refreshed my browser, it would not launch at all - at least in a usable fashion. No window would display. but there would be anywhere from 5 to 7 instances of Firefox displayed in the task manager. I tried completely uninstalling Firefox & reinstalling, but I would get a message that I already had a version installed & the installer would only allow me the option to refresh - which created the same problem. I uninstalled the browser again, did a search for all Firefox & Mozilla files, found quite a few, & manually deleted all but 2, which I was prevented from because I needed permission from "Trusted Source". The result is the same when I try to reinstall after going through this process.

At this point, I am at a loss. I really like Firefox, but it looks like i am going to be forced to move to Chrome or Edge (both of which I hate). I hope that there is a solution out there.

creator: wwplyr

title: Downloads disappear under Linux
content:
Firefox is really, really insistent upon putting its downloads into /run/user/$USERID/doc/$TEMPID. If I select "ask me" then it puts it there by default and I have to struggle with that nasty directory selector app to choose another place. If I select "Downloads", then it puts it into that temporary directory anyway (neener, neener). I looked up a support solution and it said to fiddle the browser.download.scanWhenDone value. There ain't no such a thing. Perhaps that's Windows only. There is a value for browser.download.lastDir, but it is that TEMPID thing. Those directories are removed upon download completion, so that directory (and the file) no longer exists.

Okay. This whole thing is beyond my abilities to tame. My preference is "use last directory" -- but only if it actually remembers correctly. Otherwise, save into ~/Downloads. And for God's sake, *NEVER* delete a file that I've gone to the trouble of downloading!

title: Il downlaod da mysql.aruba.it di database compressi, ritorna file non compressi
content:
Salve, quando mi connetto a "https://mysql.aruba.it" e provo a scaricare un database impostando il parametro "Compressione: " al valore "Compresso con gzip" (viene creato in tempo reale un file .sql che viene compresso e parte così il download), ottengo comunque un file di testo non compresso (anche se mantiene l'estensione .gz). Precedentemente ciò non succedeva (devo ancora capire da quale versione).

Ho aperto un ticket con Aruba ma mi hanno risposto così: "Gentile cliente, la informo che il bug riscontrato è proprio di Firefox (insito nel browser), che non ha ancora provveduto alla relativa risoluzione, né è possibile sapere se interverrà per risolvere un suo problema e quando. Le confermo che con altri browser, che potrà utilizzare, il problema non si riscontra."

Non so se può tornare utile, aggiungo ulteriori informazioni: La pagina mysql si appoggia a sua volta a "Percona Server" (5.5.62-38.14-log - Percona Server (GPL), Release 38.14, Revision 7e0e1cc). SIstema Operativo: Windows 10 64 bit. Versione di Firefox: 97.0 64 bit. Test fatto anche con la "Modalità risoluzione problemi" di Firefox.

Ho provato a cercare anche in inglese ma, poco pratico (probabilmente usando termini non corretti), non ho trovato niente. Con altri browser effettivamente il problema non sussiste. Non so se riuscite a testare la problematica. Se avete bisogno di ulteriori informazioni chiedete pure. Grazie.

title: [macOS] Lag on initial launch - fixed after browser restart
content:
Been having this issue which is probably fairly common. Did a little research beforehand and it could be a few things - but themes and extensions seem to be where to start. Also searched a few keywords on support, but it's more of the same - with resetting Firefox being the last resort. Sorry if it comes across as a bit lazy, it just seems like a simple answer that I can’t manage to find.

Pretty straightforward.. whenever I launch Firefox for the first time after restarting [Big Sur 11.6.3], it just lags. There's a lot of scrolling and input delay, everything’s down to a crawl... This is only after a restart, and on the first launch. So then I'll close FF, open it back up, and good.

I’m kind of confused because - even if I briefly open it, mere seconds, then close and reopen, it’s back to normal. So it doesn't seem as though there’s a process in the BG that hasn't completed, or something that hasn’t loaded. But, at the same time, I don’t know the intricacies of these things.

Extensions: Bitwarden, Cookie Autodelete, Decentraleyes, ExpressVPN, Ghostery, Grammarly, idontcareaboutcookies, Prettier Lichess, Privacy Badger, Tabliss, Tampermonkey, Translate Web Pages, Tree Style Tab, uBlock

It's a lot I know, most seem credible though. My guess is - maybe there's a conflict with all the ad blockers?? Maybe having Ghostery, uBlock and Privacy Badger is overkill? Outside of 'Enable Right Click’, 'Prettier Lichess' (which is excellent btw; customization options), and 'Tampermonkey'.. I’m just not really sure any of these would be the cause, but again, that’s why I’m here. Please help if you can, thanks for your time. - jazz
